name: R5-RequestStatus-R4-RequestStatus
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 RequestStatus into a FHIR R4 RequestStatus

element.display: The request is in force and ready to be acted upon.

target.display: The request is in force and ready to be acted upon.

element.display: The activity described by the request has been fully performed.  No further activity will occur.

target.display: The activity described by the request has been fully performed.  No further activity will occur.

element.display: The request has been created but is not yet complete or ready for action.

target.display: The request has been created but is not yet complete or ready for action.

element.display: This request should never have existed and should be considered 'void'.  (It is possible that real-world decisions were based on it.  If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "revoked" rather than "entered-in-error".).

target.display: This request should never have existed and should be considered 'void'.  (It is possible that real-world decisions were based on it.  If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "revoked" rather than "entered-in-error".).

element.display: The request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been temporarily withdrawn but is expected to resume in the future.

target.display: The request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been temporarily withdrawn but is expected to resume in the future.

element.display: The request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been terminated prior to the known full completion of the intended actions.  No further activity should occur.

target.display: The request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been terminated prior to the known full completion of the intended actions.  No further activity should occur.

element.display: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request.  Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply,  but the authoring/source system does not know which.

target.display: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request.  Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply,  but the authoring/source system does not know which.
